questions.question_text:
A retailer sells products by using an e-commerce site, brick and mortar stores, and phone sales.
Different processes are used for each type of order source.
You need to ensure that you can support each type of sale.
What should you recommend?

DRAG DROP -
A company plans to implement Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.
You need to recommend manufacturing process types for the company.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate manufacturing process types to the correct scenarios. Each manufacturing process type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answers are correct :
1. Process : you cannot reuse the parts, and the manufacturing chain should always follow the entire process.
2. Discrete : you cant reuse the parts, typical of many manufacturing process such as car making.
Correct

Lean production is about saving raw material and intermediate products. I think some automobile company aimed to produce the next car model of same "name-series" always with 90 % percent of materials of previous car model. I think JPN calls it "Kaizen". However Agile methods make production scalable up too. Constant returns to scale. Or decreasing or increasing returns to scale. In economics the standard assumption is decreasing returns to scale per one input of production ceteris paribus. -ES.

//IMG//

A company wants to use sales, resourcing, project management, and expense tracking in a single application.
What should the company implement?

discussion.content:
This is a certification for D365 Finance and Operations, nowhere in the learning path does it address BC functionalities. 
This sentence in the documentation..."Microsoft Dynamics 365 Project Operations connects sales, resourcing, project management, and finance teams in a single application..." has almost the same wording as the question. 
For me there is no doubt that A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer
It is obviously Project Operations, no idea why the correct answer is C.
For sure answer A, Buisness Cenral do not have all those funcuinalities.

I agree with those stating that the MS learning path did not mention Business Central. However, one of my issues with the MS learning path is that there are a number of things that are needed for certification exams that are left out (I just went through the Project Operations learning path, not once did it mention project templates and that was a question at the end of the learning path!!). I would not use the lack of mention as an indication of whether it is needed for the exam.

Selected Answer: C
C IS THE ONLY CORRECT ANSWER

Selected Answer: A
Agree with those that voted for A; learning path for MB-920 D365 Fundamentals (ERP) NEVER mentions Business Central.

Dynamics 365 Project Operations is designed to help businesses manage their sales, resourcing, project management, and expense tracking in a single application. It provides end-to-end project management capabilities, including sales, resource management, project planning, time and expense tracking, invoicing, and financial management.
Sales, not related to projects, are not included into Project Operations, so by exclusion the only possible answer is C.

Selected Answer: A
Agree with SuzieQ - First line of MS Learn Docs: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/project-operations/ is a direct quote. A. Project Operations is the answer.
First line of this website: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/project-operations/ is a direct quote. A. Project Operations is the answer.

Selected Answer: A

comments.content:
Yes, I think you're right. "Microsoft Dynamics 365 Project Operations connects sales, resourcing, project management, and finance teams in a single application." 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/identify-project-operations-capabilities/2-explore-project-based-services
I agree, your answer makes sense.

I guess because it says "Sales" they are speaking about "Sales" as a whole E2E solution, which is in PO not the case. In PO - Sales is just part of Project Management (creating leads, opportunities and quotes). The question is not clear, however, BC covers all the requirements...

discussion.content: Answer is correct.
